intro: Rayjacksonia, commonly known as the Christmas star, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its succulent characteristics. The plant produces vibrant, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. Rayjacksonia is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
